column5: well got out today for a few hours after school to do some perchin. i drilled my first hole and it was in 40' of water, i was marking fish right away so i droped down a forge minnow jiggin spoon and caught about 10 bettween 6-8 inches lol  . so i droped down a high low rig with 2 minnows and instantly got bit. pulled up a nice 11 incher   not a bad perch.    pic of my rod lol    then after a few minutes i got a 11 1/2 inch perch, lots of nice sized smelt caught as well.  so here is my catch for todays short time out.    and the two bigger ones    was a good couple hours out on the ice.
Wow!! Nice work for a few hours!  I was out for 6 hours on Saturday on the BOG and got nada!! Nice pics...thanks for the report.
WTG man... Nice to see that you had some luck and more importantly you enjoyed yourself. Great report...
Well done pikie, thanks for the report.  Those smelt are Laker bait, btw.
i was told they work good, but i was also told that they are illegal to use on simcoe, dont no if its true or not?
Good stuff pikie.  I haven't caught any smelt in a few years. Nice to see they're still around.
yea its not too far out untill it drops off.
Great stuff Pikeie...glad to see a young lad with a sense of adventure these days!
well done man,looks like a nice fish-fry tonight ...WTG  thanks for the report and pics of those tasty perch and a few smelt for a bonus

Well done buddy. I have been hearing some reports of large schools of rainbow smelts in the area.They sure make a good eat.  I,ll be down there one day this weekend to fish for the smelts only.,   I couldnt agree more Wayne.
Nice report and pics to share with us, Pikie!  Enjoy the meal, including the 'bonus' smelt!
nice job brother.  u just fishin out from the marina in 40 fow ??
Well done, glad someone is doing great on Simcoe.   Next time I am following you
